content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the model sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2 and use the Inference API on the webpage to get the similarity of the following two sentences: 'Tomorrow is Sunday', 'Eat a burger on Sunday'.  Please interact with https://huggingface.co/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to find the sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2 model. The search bar at [1] is likely where I can type in the model name to search for it.
Action: Type [1]; sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page shows the "Qwen-Image-Edit" model, not the "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" model that I need. I should refine my search or try searching again to get the correct model.
Action: Type [1]; sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search didn't change the results, likely because the search term wasn't properly submitted or a search confirmation step was missed. I may need to press enter or click a search confirmation button after entering the model name.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search bar has displayed a dropdown list of models, but "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" is not visible yet. I should scroll down the dropdown list to find the desired model.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search dropdown still does not show the required "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" model. Scrolling more may help if it is further down the list.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search dropdown still hasn't reached the model "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2." Only the models in the "deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-V3.1-Base" and nearby range are shown. I need to continue scrolling to find the correct model.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search dropdown is revealing more models but "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" is still not visible. Scrolling further is required in the dropdown.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.88
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown list is progressing, but the required "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" is not yet visible. More scrolling is needed through the models list.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.88
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current results show the "google/embeddinggemma-300m" model, still not the "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" model. I should continue scrolling down the dropdown list to find the needed model.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.88
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown has now reached the "Datasets" section, but the required model "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" has not appeared, indicating it is either much further down or my search method might not be yielding the intended model results. However, I should continue scrolling just a bit further to ensure it's not immediately below.
Action: Scroll [1]; down
Confidence: 0.87
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown has reached more dataset results, but the "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" model is still not visible. Since scrolling in the dropdown hasn't revealed the model, it's possible that the method of searching is not showing all matches, or the search query needs to be submitted via another mechanism (like pressing enter or clicking outside). I should try clicking outside the dropdown to see if the full search results populate the page instead.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.20
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back on the Hugging Face homepage, where I can use the top search bar again. The previous search attempt did not yield "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2" directly. I should enter the search term again and look for results in the main results area, not just dropdown.
Action: Type [1]; sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.20

I need to ensure the search actually targets the required sentence-transformers model, and possibly use the search bar again and confirm with Enter or choose relevant dropdown result more carefully.

Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.20
